DataElement.preferredName: Person Recovered or Resolved Prior Treatment Regimen Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation regarding the resolution of adverse events from prior therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Recovered or Resolved Prior Treatment Regimen Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person's recovery from prior therapy as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Recovered or Resolved Prior Treatment Regimen Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has improved or recuperated.:Earlier in time or order.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has improved or recuperated.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from adverse events attributable to previous treatment to less than or equal to grade 1, except for alopecia and sensory neuropathy less than or equal to grade 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient recovered from ad
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from adverse events attributable to previous treatment to less than or equal to grade 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have any adverse events from prior therapy resolved to baseline or grade less than or equal to 1 if resolvable at enrollment (with the exception of alopecia, neuropathy, and ototoxicity)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have toxicities related to prior treatment resolved to less than or equal to grade 1 or baseline with the exception of alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to less than or equal to Grade 1 from any adverse events from any prior chemotherapy (other than alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior medical therapy for their PN, has patient recovered from the acute toxic effects of all prior therapy to less than or equal to grade 1 CTCAEv4 before entering this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have all greater than grade 1 adverse events related to prior therapies (chemotherapy, radiotherapy, and/or surgery) have resolved, except for alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered have from any acute toxicity related to prior therapy or surgery, to a grade 1 or less unless specified?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from any acute toxicity related to prior therapy or surgery, to a grade 1 or less unless specified?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient greater than or equal to 2 weeks from resolution (i.e., less than Grade 1 or at baseline) from AEs due to procedures performed or therapeutic agents administered?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from any acute effects of any prior chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to less than or equal to grade 1 NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0 or stabilized from toxicity of prior chemotherapy or biologic therapy administered more than 4 weeks or 5 half-lives earlier, whichever is shorter?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have all prior treatment related-toxicities resolved to CTCAE version 4.0 grade less than or equal to 1 (except alopecia) at the time of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have all prior anti-cancer treatment-related toxicities resolved to ≤ Grade 1 according to the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events version 4 (CTCAE version 4.0; NCI, 2009) at the time of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have all greater than grade 1 adverse events related to prior therapies (chemotherapy, radiotherapy, and/or surgery) resolved, except for alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to grade 1 from prior toxicity or adverse events?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to grade 1 adverse events or to less than or equal to grade 2 alopecia and sensory neuropathy due to prior treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to less than or equal to grade 1 adverse events or to less than or equal to grade 2 alopecia and sensory neuropathy due to prior treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to less than or greater to grade 1 adverse events or to less than or equal to grade 2 alopecia and sensory neuropathy due to prior treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have ongoing prior toxicities related to previous treatments recovered to less than grade 2 at the time of registration (with the exception of alopecia, grade 2 peripheral neuropathy or lymphopenia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have all prior treatment related-toxicities resolved to CTCAE version 5.0 grade less than or equal to 1 (except alopecia) at the time of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior medical therapy for their PN, has patient recovered from the acute toxic effects of all prior therapy to less than or equal to grade 1 before entering this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to less than or equal to grade 1 from the toxicities of these prior therapies, except for stable chronic grade 2 toxicity that is not overlapping with presumed toxicities of olaparib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to less than or equal to grade 1 NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) or stabilized from toxicity of prior chemotherapy or biologic therapy administered more than 4 weeks or 5 half-lives earlier, whichever is shorter?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior anti-cancer treatments (i.e. chemotherapy, including gemcitabine and nab-paclitaxel; radiotherapy; hormonal, or immunotherapy with the exception of anti-CTLA4, anti-PD1/PD-L1, and combination of anti-CTLA4 and anti-PD1/PD-L1), have toxicities (except for alopecia) related to prior anti-cancer therapy and/or surgery either resolved, improved to baseline or grade 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from the effects of any prior systemic therapy, radiotherapy or surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to baseline or less than or equal to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v5.0 grade 1 from toxicities related to any prior treatments, unless AE(s) are clinically non-significant and/or stable on supportive therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have toxicities from prior therapies recovered to less than or equal to grade 1, with the exception of stable chronic grade 2 toxicities that are not overlapping with presumed toxicities of olaparib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from toxicities of any prior treatment regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from the acute toxic effects of prior therapy to a grade 1 (CTCAE v.5.0) level prior to enrollment (does not apply to alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from all non-hematologic toxicities of prior chemotherapy, surgery, or radiotherapy, except alopecia, using National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE), to less than or equal to grade 1, prior to starting therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have therapy-related toxicities resolved to less than or equal to Grade 1 or baseline as per the judgement of the treating investigator (with the exception of alopecia, peripheral neuropathy, or rash that will be permitted at less than or equal to Grade 2)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient not recovered from adverse events from prior cancer therapy (greater than grade 1), except for: alopecia (any grade), neuropathy greater than grade 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient recovered from the acute toxicities of any prior therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to eligibility levels from prior toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from the acute toxic effects of all prior anti-cancer therapies (with the exception of alopecia and lymphopenia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient fully recovered from the acute toxic effects of all chemotherapy, immunotherapy, or radiotherapy prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1) with the exception of alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities less than or equal to Grade 1 or baseline)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from adverse events of previously administered therapeutic agents to Grade 2 or less toxicity according to CTCAE 5.0?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received chemotherapy, have they recovered (Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events [CTCAE] Grade less than or equal to 1) from the acute effects of chemotherapy except for residual alopecia or Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient received prior chemotherapy, has the patient recovered (Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events [CTCAE] Grade less than or equal to1) from the acute effects of chemotherapy except for residual alopecia or Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to less than or equal to Grade 1 or baseline of any toxicities due to prior systemic treatments, excluding alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient fully recovered from the acute toxic effects of all prior chemotherapy, immunotherapy, or radiotherapy prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 44
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have any therapy-related toxicities resolved to less than or equal to Grade 1 or baseline (with the exception of alopecia, peripheral neuropathy, or rash that will be permitted at less than or equal to Grade 2)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 45
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to eligibility levels from prior toxicity or adverse events?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 46
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received palliative radiotherapy, have they recovered from any radiotherapy related adverse events (allow at least 3 days between radiotherapy completion and study treatment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 47
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from clinically significant side effects from prior cancer therapy to grade 1 or below?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradrex - 49
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered (CTCAE Grade less than or equal to 1) from the acute effects of chemotherapy except for residual alopecia or Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 48
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient fully recovered from the acute toxic effects of all prior chemotherapy, immunotherapy, or radiotherapy prior to initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 50
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities less than or equal to Grade 1) with the exception of alopecia or anorexia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 51
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities > Grade 1), with the exception of alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance text -1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If Yes, has the patient fully recovered from any acute toxicities?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has no ongoing toxicity from prior PRRT that is Grade 3 or higher according to CTCAE 5.0.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 52
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to grade 1 or baseline from any toxicities?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 53
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from any clinically relevant toxic effects of any prior surgery, radiotherapy, or chemotherapy treatment with temozolomide?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 54
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities > Grade 1), with the exception of alopecia or as otherwise specified in the eligibility criteria?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 12/21/22 added AQT and alt OID, CCTG for ticket number CADSR0001818 cjl.
